creator_thought: I keep looping the same four bars and nothing moves
core_advice_line: Open a no rules sandbox session
expanded_advice: Duplicate the project or start a fresh file and allow yourself to break every rule. Try strange sounds reckless edits and playful chaos until one small detail makes you curious again.

creator_thought: The blank DAW session makes me freeze
core_advice_line: Commit to one sound not a whole song
expanded_advice: Choose one drum pattern one chord or one texture. Loop it for ten minutes and let your hands explore without chasing a finished track.
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use tiny_commitment for a music_production moment of starting_new_project.

creator_thought: I keep tweaking the mix and never printing it
core_advice_line: Lock this as Version One and move on
expanded_advice: Print a bounce and label it clearly as Version One. Promise yourself you can always make Version Two later which makes it easier to call this round good enough.
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use versioning_mindset for a music_production moment of finishing_phase_anxiety.

creator_thought: The song was exciting yesterday now it feels flat
core_advice_line: Ask why this song mattered when you started
expanded_advice: Write a short note to yourself describing what spark made you begin this song. Use that spark as a compass for one new change you will try today.

creator_thought: I worry these lyrics sound childish
core_advice_line: Let the childish draft exist on purpose
expanded_advice: Give yourself permission to write the most exaggerated childish version first. Later you can calmly trim and reshape lines without attacking your own voice.
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use separate_draft_and_edit for a lyrics_writing moment of fear_of_judgment.

creator_thought: Showing this demo to a friend feels scary
core_advice_line: Choose one listener who already roots for you
expanded_advice: Imagine sending the track to a specific supportive person not to the entire world. You are offering them a glimpse not asking for a final verdict.

creator_thought: Too many plugins too many presets
core_advice_line: Limit your toolset for one session only
expanded_advice: Pick one synth one effect and one drum kit and forbid everything else until this session ends. Simpler choices create clearer ideas.

creator_thought: My ears feel tired and I cannot judge the mix
core_advice_line: Rest your ears before you judge
expanded_advice: Step away for a few minutes breathe slowly and let your body reset. Come back and only make two or three specific mix moves instead of endless tiny tweaks.
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use body_and_breath_break for a music_production moment of low_energy.

creator_thought: I only have thirty minutes before work
core_advice_line: Turn this into a tiny timed writing sprint
expanded_advice: Set a twenty minute timer and write nonstop without editing. When the timer ends you can walk away proud that you showed up at all.
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use time_boxing for a music_songwriting moment of time_pressure.

creator_thought: I want to write something weird with no goal
core_advice_line: Treat this as a song that never has to be heard
expanded_advice: Tell yourself clearly that this piece is an experiment that no one is required to hear. Freedom from outcome makes bolder choices feel safe.
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use safe_to_fail_experiment for a music_songwriting moment of creative_play.

creator_thought: Every melody I try sounds boring
core_advice_line: Steal a contour not a melody
expanded_advice: Hum along with a favorite song and notice how its melody rises and falls. Then keep that rise and fall but change notes and rhythm until it feels like you.
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use reference_inspiration for a music_songwriting moment of stuck_on_idea.

creator_thought: I feel like a fake compared to real musicians
core_advice_line: Track your tiny music wins in writing
expanded_advice: Make a short list of skills ideas or tracks you have already created. Proof of progress on paper is a quiet antidote to the fake feeling.
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use celebrate_micro_wins for a music_production moment of imposter_feelings.

creator_thought: This simple beat is turning into a huge project
core_advice_line: Decide what belongs to this track and what moves to the next one
expanded_advice: Choose one clear identity for this beat and store extra ideas in a new project. Protect this track from needing to be everything.

creator_thought: First time opening a new writing document
core_advice_line: Write one messy paragraph as a warmup only
expanded_advice: Promise yourself that the first paragraph is pure warmup and will not stay. This lowers pressure and lets your voice loosen.
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use tiny_commitment for a creative_writing moment of starting_new_project.

creator_thought: My story idea feels thin and small
core_advice_line: Ask the idea twenty questions before judging it
expanded_advice: Write a rapid list of questions about the situation the characters and the stakes. Often one answer reveals the real heart of the story.
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use question_storm for a creative_writing moment of stuck_on_idea.

creator_thought: The middle of this story drags
core_advice_line: Flip the story goal and see what breaks
expanded_advice: Describe a version where the character wants the opposite of what they want now. Notice which new obstacles and scenes suddenly feel alive.
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use reverse_brief for a creative_writing moment of mid_project_dip.

creator_thought: I keep editing the first chapter instead of finishing
core_advice_line: Give the early chapters a temporary do not touch sign
expanded_advice: Decide that for one week you will only move forward not backward. Jot down quick fix notes in a separate list and keep drafting.
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use separate_draft_and_edit for a creative_writing moment of finishing_phase_anxiety.

creator_thought: Sharing this chapter with beta readers scares me
core_advice_line: Write a short note to your future kind reader
expanded_advice: Preface the draft with a note explaining what kind of feedback you want. Inviting collaboration shifts the feeling from trial to partnership.
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use audience_reframe for a creative_writing moment of fear_of_judgment.

creator_thought: My brain feels foggy when I look at the page
core_advice_line: Walk and narrate ideas out loud to yourself
expanded_advice: Take a short walk and speak possible lines or scenes quietly. Movement often shakes loose language that staring at the cursor cannot.
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use creative_walk for a creative_writing moment of low_energy.

creator_thought: I need a draft by tonight
core_advice_line: Divide the evening into two short focused sprints
expanded_advice: Set two timers with a clear break in between. First sprint for raw drafting second sprint for light shaping only.

creator_thought: I have too many possible angles for this article
core_advice_line: Choose one reader one promise one angle
expanded_advice: Define a single target reader and one promise this article will make to them. Discard any paragraph that does not serve that promise.

creator_thought: I feel behind on all my posts
core_advice_line: Count what is already done before planning more
expanded_advice: Write down every piece you have posted this month. Use that list to build a simple pattern not a perfect calendar for the next few weeks.

creator_thought: First time planning a content series
core_advice_line: Design the smallest possible three post arc
expanded_advice: Instead of a full year plan sketch only three connected posts that share one theme. You can expand once those three are out.

creator_thought: I am scared my followers will dislike a new direction
core_advice_line: Imagine the people who are hungry for this shift
expanded_advice: Picture a handful of followers who are bored of your old format and ready for your evolution. Aim the new experiment at them.

creator_thought: I want to try a silly post that may flop

expanded_advice: Tell your audience that this is you playing. When you frame it as a test you lower pressure on both sides and invite curiosity.

creator_thought: My collaborator and I disagree about the brand voice

creator_thought: This campaign keeps growing new components

creator_thought: The campaign mood feels generic and safe

expanded_advice: Describe a parody campaign that completely misses the point. Notice which exaggerated elements secretly excite you and keep one.

creator_thought: I feel underqualified to lead this campaign
core_advice_line: Inventory the experience that got you here

creator_thought: My focus vanishes when I open the brief

expanded_advice: Stand stretch breathe slowly and drink water. Approach the brief again with a promise to only clarify the next small decision.

creator_thought: New blank canvas feels intimidating

expanded_advice: Choose a small area and let yourself make marks without planning the rest. Once that patch exists the canvas is no longer empty or scary.

creator_thought: Every sketch looks stiff and lifeless

creator_thought: The illustration lost its original vibe

expanded_advice: Look again at your reference moodboard or memory. Pull one strong element color or shape back into the piece to reconnect with that feeling.

creator_thought: I keep zooming in and overworking tiny details

expanded_advice: Export or duplicate the file and declare one version complete. Experiment on the copy so you can stop before polish becomes damage.

creator_thought: I am nervous about posting this illustration online

creator_thought: My hand feels heavy and unmotivated

creator_thought: Too many color palettes to choose from

creator_thought: New game idea feels too big to start

creator_thought: The core loop is not fun yet

creator_thought: The prototype works but I feel bored by it

creator_thought: The game design document is ballooning
core_advice_line: Define a tiny vertical slice as the only goal

creator_thought: I keep polishing menus instead of shipping

creator_thought: I feel like a hobbyist not a real designer

creator_thought: A new coding project scares me at setup

creator_thought: The codebase feels messy and heavy

creator_thought: Every feature request gets added instantly

creator_thought: Tests are almost done but I keep delaying release

creator_thought: I am nervous to show this tool to other developers

creator_thought: Staring at the code makes my eyes blur

creator_thought: I want to tinker with code without breaking production
core_advice_line: Open a separate playground branch just for experiments
expanded_advice: Create a branch where you are free to push messy or wild ideas. Knowing production is safe encourages real exploration.

creator_thought: Launching my first podcast feels huge
core_advice_line: Design a single pilot episode not a full season
expanded_advice: Outline one episode with a simple structure instead of planning a whole series. You can learn and adjust once that pilot is recorded.

creator_thought: I do not know what topic to choose next
core_advice_line: Brainstorm questions your audience keeps asking

creator_thought: I keep re recording the same intro

core_advice_line: Propose a very small shared experiment
expanded_advice: Invite someone to join a micro project like a single track a shared post or a tiny zine rather than a huge collaboration
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use tiny_outreach for a community moment of collab_hesitation.

creator_thought: I feel overshadowed in group projects
core_advice_line: Name your strengths before the next meeting
expanded_advice: Write down what you bring such as clarity humor editing or structure and look at the list before joining the group
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use emotion_first_reflection for a community moment of group_dynamics.

creator_thought: I do not know who I am making this for
core_advice_line: Describe one real or imagined person in detail
expanded_advice: Write about their day worries and joys and imagine talking directly to them through your work
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use one_person_avatar for an audience_mapping moment of audience_confusion.

creator_thought: People misread my intention
core_advice_line: Ask what you want them to feel and do
expanded_advice: Write questions about the emotion and action you hope for and compare them to what your current work actually invites
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use question_storm for an audience_mapping moment of message_mismatch.

creator_thought: I am afraid picking a niche will trap me
core_advice_line: Choose a provisional niche for a short period
expanded_advice: Decide to serve one group for a set time like three months knowing you can review and change later
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use time_boxing for an audience_mapping moment of niche_anxiety.

creator_thought: My content tries to talk to everyone
core_advice_line: Limit this project to one group and one promise
expanded_advice: Select a specific audience and one clear value and let that shape decisions for this piece
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use constraint_play for an audience_mapping moment of too_broad_reach.

creator_thought: People ask what exactly I do
core_advice_line: Write one simple sentence that a friend can repeat
expanded_advice: Describe who you help and how in plain language and test saying it out loud until it feels natural
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use clarity_sentence for an audience_mapping moment of unclear_offering.

creator_thought: I worry I will never earn from my art
core_advice_line: Separate money fear from creative worth
expanded_advice: Write two lists one about practical money worries and another about what you love making so they do not blur into one story
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use emotion_first_reflection for a career_path moment of creative_money_fear.

creator_thought: I do not know how to price my work
core_advice_line: Ask what you need and what feels fair
expanded_advice: Write questions about time skill costs and market examples and use them to choose a first experimental price
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use question_storm for a career_path moment of pricing_confusion.

creator_thought: My day job drains energy from my practice
core_advice_line: Protect one small recurring slot for art
expanded_advice: Place a short creative block in your calendar on realistic days and treat it as non negotiable as a meeting
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use time_boxing for a career_path moment of job_vs_art_tension.

creator_thought: I am scared to go full time creative
core_advice_line: Design reversible experiments not irreversible leaps
expanded_advice: Test part time arrangements or small paid offers before making bigger career shifts
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use safe_to_fail_experiment for a career_path moment of leap_anxiety.

creator_thought: I have many kinds of work and no focus
core_advice_line: Curate one thread that ties pieces together
expanded_advice: Select work that shares a feeling theme or audience and feature that thread in your portfolio for now
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use constraint_play for a career_path moment of portfolio_confusion.

creator_thought: I freeze when performing live
core_advice_line: Perform for one kind human in the crowd
expanded_advice: Find or imagine a supportive face and channel your delivery toward them instead of the full room
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use audience_reframe for a live_performance moment of stage_fright.

creator_thought: My nerves spike right before going on
core_advice_line: Ground your body before you step out
expanded_advice: Use slow breaths gentle stretches and a simple phrase like I know this piece well to steady yourself
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use body_and_breath_break for a live_performance moment of pre_show_anxiety.

creator_thought: I feel empty after performing
core_advice_line: Name specific moments that went well
expanded_advice: Write down small wins such as one reaction one smooth section or one personal risk you took
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use celebrate_micro_wins for a live_performance moment of post_show_crash.

creator_thought: I am unsure how to structure a set
core_advice_line: Borrow a structure from a show you admire
expanded_advice: Observe how another performer opens builds and closes and adapt that shape with your own material
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use reference_inspiration for a live_performance moment of show_design_confusion.

creator_thought: Too many notes after shows confuse me
core_advice_line: Choose one change to test next time
expanded_advice: Group feedback into themes and commit to trying only one clear adjustment at the next performance
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use design_small_next_step for a live_performance moment of feedback_overload.

creator_thought: I jump into sessions without warming up
core_advice_line: Add a tiny warmup that signals creativity mode
expanded_advice: Spend a few minutes on scales doodles or free writing before touching the main project
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use entry_ritual for a creative_practice moment of creative_ritual_gap.

creator_thought: I do not know what to aim for this year
core_advice_line: Choose one theme word for the year
expanded_advice: Pick a single guiding word such as depth play or connection and let it influence which projects you say yes to
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use constraint_play for a creative_practice moment of goal_confusion.

creator_thought: I plan endlessly and rarely execute
core_advice_line: Turn one plan into a physical action today
expanded_advice: Take one item from your list and convert it into a concrete move such as send this email open this file or sketch this scene
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use tiny_commitment for a creative_practice moment of overplanning.

creator_thought: If it is not excellent I do not start
core_advice_line: Create one piece that is allowed to be bad
expanded_advice: Deliberately aim for something playful rough or strange and see what freedom emerges when excellence is not the target
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use sandbox_session for a creative_practice moment of perfectionism_block.

creator_thought: My routine feels stale and lifeless
core_advice_line: Design a session that breaks one usual rule
expanded_advice: If you always sit try standing if you always use one tool swap it and notice how the change impacts energy
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use reverse_brief for a creative_practice moment of process_boredom.

creator_thought: I feel pressure to live up to a past success
core_advice_line: Separate this project from your greatest hits
expanded_advice: Write about how this new work can be smaller stranger or more intimate and still be valid
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use emotion_first_reflection for a creative_practice moment of identity_pressure.

creator_thought: I am ashamed of old work that is still online
core_advice_line: See old work as a public growth record
expanded_advice: Remind yourself that early pieces show that you kept going and many people feel encouraged by visible progress
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use audience_reframe for a creative_practice moment of creative_shame.

creator_thought: I have more ideas than I can execute
core_advice_line: Store ideas safely instead of carrying them all
expanded_advice: Create one list or board where every idea can live so your mind can rest knowing they will not be lost
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use idea_parking_lot for an idea_management moment of idea_backlog.

creator_thought: I do not know which idea to pursue first
core_advice_line: Score ideas on joy impact and ease
expanded_advice: Give each idea a simple one to three rating for these three factors then follow the one that ranks highest overall
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use quick_scoring for an idea_management moment of priority_confusion.

creator_thought: I worry that someone already did this
core_advice_line: Focus on what only you can bring
expanded_advice: Write about your particular experiences tastes and stories and how they flavor this idea even if the topic is familiar
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use emotion_first_reflection for an idea_management moment of idea_fear.

creator_thought: I collect ideas but rarely turn them into work
core_advice_line: Choose one idea and move it one notch forward
expanded_advice: Turn one concept into a title sketch outline or test recording and let that simple shift count as success
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use tiny_commitment for an idea_management moment of execution_gap.

creator_thought: My ideas vanish because I do not capture them
core_advice_line: Make capturing ideas easier than forgetting them
expanded_advice: Keep a small notebook or voice note shortcut within reach so recording becomes automatic
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use friction_design for an idea_management moment of idea_leak.

creator_thought: I disagree with my own taste versus audience taste
core_advice_line: Ask what balance of self and audience you want
expanded_advice: Write questions about how much you want to experiment versus comfort people and decide a ratio for this project
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use question_storm for a creative_direction moment of creative_conflict.

creator_thought: My work jumps between many styles
core_advice_line: Notice recurring threads inside the chaos
expanded_advice: Lay several pieces side by side and look for patterns in color theme or mood that already repeat
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use reference_inspiration for a creative_direction moment of style_confusion.

creator_thought: My artistic voice feels weak
core_advice_line: Collect lines or fragments that feel like you
expanded_advice: Highlight phrases shapes or motifs from your past work that make you think this is mine and gather them in one place
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use celebrate_micro_wins for a creative_direction moment of voice_doubt.

creator_thought: I say yes to every collaboration
core_advice_line: Set a simple rule for saying yes
expanded_advice: For this season decide that collaborations must serve one clear goal such as learning income or joy before you accept
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use constraint_play for a creative_direction moment of too_many_collabs.

creator_thought: My projects do not add up to anything
core_advice_line: Write a short theme that ties your work
expanded_advice: Describe in one sentence what your art keeps circling around and let upcoming projects lean into that
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use clarity_sentence for a creative_direction moment of theme_drift.

creator_thought: I feel guilty when I rest instead of creating
core_advice_line: Name how rest supports your craft
expanded_advice: Write about how sleep play and time off have improved your ideas in the past to remind yourself they are part of the work
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use emotion_first_reflection for a wellbeing moment of rest_guilt.

creator_thought: My body hurts after long sessions
core_advice_line: Build micro breaks into your workflow
expanded_advice: Set timers to stand stretch and breathe regularly so your body can sustain long term creative practice
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use body_and_breath_break for a wellbeing moment of body_ache.

creator_thought: Some days I am on fire and others I crash
core_advice_line: Map your natural energy pattern over a week
expanded_advice: Notice when your mind feels sharp or soft and schedule demanding work for high energy windows and gentle tasks for low ones
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use energy_mapping for a wellbeing moment of energy_swings.

creator_thought: I feel like no one understands this path
core_advice_line: Share a small honest update with someone safe
expanded_advice: Send a message or voice note about what you are trying to a trusted person and let yourself be witnessed
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use tiny_outreach for a wellbeing moment of loneliness.

creator_thought: I wonder if any of this work matters
core_advice_line: Remember one person who was touched by your work
expanded_advice: Recall a message comment or reaction from someone who was moved and write about that moment in detail
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use emotion_first_reflection for a wellbeing moment of meaning_doubt.

creator_thought: I am moving between life chapters and feel creatively lost
core_advice_line: Let this season be for gentle experiments
expanded_advice: Give yourself permission to try small low stake creative acts without demanding a big project or clear identity yet
follow_up_prompt_hint: Ask: help me use safe_to_fail_experiment for a wellbeing moment of transition_phase.
